com.week9.solution.io.util

Class FileArray

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.week9.solution.io.util.FileArray
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class FileArray
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.AutoCloseable
    Holds an array as a RandomAccessFile.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FileArray(java.lang.Integer[] original, java.lang.String name)
      Creates a new FileArray, therefore creates a new file with the name name.
      FileArray(java.lang.String name)
      Creates a FileArray from an already existing array.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Closes this FileArray
      java.lang.Integer get(int i)
      Returns the element that is stored at position i.
      int length()
      Returns the number of elements in this FileArray.
      void set(int i, java.lang.Integer elem)
      Updates the element at position i with elem.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • FileArray

        public FileArray(java.lang.Integer[] original,
                 java.lang.String name)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a new FileArray, therefore creates a new file with the name name. If that file already existed, it will be overridden. Writes every element from original into that file.
        Parameters:
        original - the array which should be stored in the file with the name name
        name - the name of the file where original should be stored
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • FileArray

        public FileArray(java.lang.String name)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a FileArray from an already existing array. It the given name exists but is not a FileArray, no exception will be thrown, but the return values of get(int) will be unpredictable.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the file which contains the array to be read.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if name does not exist
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public java.lang.Integer get(int i)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Returns the element that is stored at position i.
        Parameters:
        i - position from which the element should be read
        Returns:
        the element at position i
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • set

        public void set(int i,
                java.lang.Integer elem)
         throws java.io.IOException
        Updates the element at position i with elem.
        Parameters:
        i - position to update
        elem - the value to which the element at position i should be replaced
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • length

        public int length()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Returns the number of elements in this FileArray.
        Returns:
        number of elements in this FileArray
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • close

        public void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Closes this FileArray
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
